title: 2005: Sadako Ogata, Japanese Diplomat - PON - Program on Negotiation at Harvard Law School

quotes: Sadako Ogata began her career in diplomacy in 1968, serving on the Japanese delegation to the United Nations General Assembly and as a minister on the Permanent Mission of Japan to the UN.
In 1979, she led a mission to provide assistance to Cambodian refugees.
In 1990, she became UN high commissioner for refugees, a post she held for a decade.
Her book The Turbulent Decade: Confronting the Refugee Crises of the 1990s was published in 2005.

organizations.name: Imagine Coexistence project
quotes: In addition to her diplomatic duties, Ogata has been actively involved in initiatives such as the Imagine Coexistence project, which funded joint economic activities aimed at minimizing conflict in unstable regions.
